list_definition.definition: one of four equal parts of something which together form the whole (amount) of the thing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There are four of us, so we’ll cut the cake into quarters
It’s (a) quarter past / American after four
In the first quarter of the year his firm made a profit
The shop is about a quarter of a mile away

list_definition.definition: in the United States and Canada, (a coin worth) twenty-five cents, the fourth part of a dollar.
a district or part of a town especially where a particular group of people live

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He lives in the Polish quarter of the town.
People were coming at me from all quarters.

list_definition.mean_english: sự tha chết cho hàng binh

list_definition.definition: the leg of a usually large animal, or a joint of meat which includes a leg
the shape of the moon at the end of the first and third weeks of its cycle; the first or fourth week of the cycle itself.
one of four equal periods of play in some games

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: In the second quarter of the game, the Bears quarterback was intercepted.

list_definition.definition: a period of study at a college etc, usually 10 to 12 weeks in length.

list_definition.mean_english: chia thành bốn phần bằng nhau
list_definition.definition: to cut into four equal parts

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’ll quarter the cake and then we’ll all have an equal share.
If we each do the work at the same time, we could quarter the time it would take to finish the job.

list_definition.mean_english: cung cấp chỗ ở cho ai
list_definition.definition: to give (especially a soldier) somewhere to stay

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The soldiers were quartered all over the town.

list_ex_of_english: Sixteen of the seventeen properties on which repairs were made had living quarters improved as well as out buildings.
They also helped set and clear their tables, clean their quarters, and put away their playthings.
With the proposed weights,9 that number increases to three quarters.
Turning point predictions are calculated using a two quarters rule, as detailed in the next section.
The real interest rate increases and remains positive for four quarters.
Also, quarterly climate data were always highly correlated with the same data from other quarters.
Certainly they are shorter and more syllabic, but when note values are quartered they look just as elaborate rhythmically.
Farmers may be aware that recovered quarters are at higher risk of infection.
